content:
One day, Emily and Sarah decided to bring Lucy to a party that they were attending with their parents. They thought that it would be a fun and exciting experience for her, and they were looking forward to showing her off to their friends.

They carefully placed Lucy on a large, padded tray that they had made especially for her, and they wrapped her up in a cozy blanket to keep her warm. Then, they carefully lifted the tray and carried her out to the car, excited to show her off to their friends.

At the party, Emily and Sarah introduced Lucy to their friends and told them all about her special abilities and adventures. They showed everyone how she could slide under tables and into tight spaces, and how she could spot small objects that others might miss.

At first, everyone was fascinated by Lucy and her unique abilities. They asked her questions and asked to see more of what she could do. However, as the party went on, things started to go wrong.

First, a group of rowdy kids knocked over the tray that Lucy was lying on, causing her to roll off and onto the floor. Then, someone accidentally stepped on her, flattening her even further. Finally, someone spilled a drink all over her, soaking her blanket and leaving her shivering and miserable.

Feeling embarrassed and disappointed, Emily and Sarah helped Lucy back onto the tray and wrapped her up in a dry blanket. They apologized for the mishaps and promised to be more careful in the future.

Despite the difficulties, Lucy was still grateful to her sisters for bringing her to the party and for all of their efforts to make her feel included. She knew that they had only wanted the best for her, and she forgave them for the mistakes that had been made.

From then on, the sisters were more careful about the events and parties that they brought Lucy to, making sure that she was well-prepared and had all of the support and accommodations that she needed to have a good time.
